profile.profileName: [New School, New York, NY, USA] Kellen Design Archives
profile.profileDescription: This profile configures CollectiveAccess for use as an archive for images, documents, video and audio programs.

label.name_singular: Anna-Maria and Stephen Kellen Design Archives
label.name_plural: Anna-Maria and Stephen Kellen Design Archives

label.name_singular: Library of Congress Name Authority File
label.name_plural: Library of Congress Name Authority Files

label.name: Work type: Clippings and Tear sheets
Title types for media production and versioning
Format: Physical Types For Moving Images
Format Generations Types For Moving Images
Format Generations Types For Static Images
Description
label.description: An account of the resource.

label.name: Caption
label.description: Short descriptive caption for item.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Coordinates documenting the location of the item

label.name: Internal Notes
label.description: Notes regarding item

label.name: GeoNames
label.description: A Geographic lookup that takes search text, passes it to the GeoNames search service and provides a drop down with search results (ordered by score). Selected geoname is stored as both text (name, country, continent and ID) and the service URL identifier.

label.name: Library of Congress Names Authority
label.description: Library of Congress Subject headings describing this object. To add a new heading simply type the first few letters of the heading and choose the desired one from the displayed list of possible matches.

label.name: Library of Congress Topical Authority
label.description: Library of Congress Subject headings describing this object. To add a new heading simply type the first few letters of the heading and choose the desired one from the displayed list of possible matches.

label.name: Library of Congress Geographic Areas Authority
label.description: Library of Congress Subject headings describing this object. To add a new heading simply type the first few letters of the heading and choose the desired one from the displayed list of possible matches.

label.name: Inscription
label.description: All marks or written words added to the object at the time of production or in its subsequent history, including signatures, dates, dedications, texts, and colophons, as well as marks, such as the stamps of silversmiths, publishers, or printers. The location of this text or symbol may be specified by the position subelement. If a translation of the text into the language of the catalog record is also provided, include in a repeated element with the text type of translation.

label.name: Measurements
label.description: The physical size, shape, scale, dimensions, or format of the Work or Image. Dimensions may include such measurements as volume, weight, area or running time.

label.name: Rights
label.description: Information about the copyright status and the rights holder for a work, collection, or image. The optional notes sub-element may include any justifications, conditions, or restraints on use, contact or licensing information, or other intellectual property statements as may be desired.

label.name: Source
label.description: refers to the local, print, or electronic source from which information is derived for a specific element (e.g. Grove Dictionary of Art).

label.name: Description
label.description: A free-text note about the Work, Collection, or Image, including comments, description, or interpretation, that gives additional information not recorded in other categories. For element-specific notes, use the optional notes subelement.

label.name: Dates
label.description: Date or range of dates associated with the creation, design, production, presentation, performance, construction, or alteration, etc. of the work or image. See CCO Chapter 4: Stylistic and Chronological Information for a more thorough discussion of dates.

label.name: Extension
label.description: The descriptor extension accommodates metadata descriptions crafted by metadata dictionaries and schemas outside of the PBCore Metadata Dictionary Project. These extensions fulfill the local metadata requirements for communities and stations identifying and describing their own types of media with specialized, custom terminologies.

label.name: Description
label.description: The metadata element description uses free-form text or a narrative to report general notes, abstracts, or summaries about the work of a media item you are cataloging. The information may be in the form of a paragraph giving an individual program description, anecdotal interpretations, or brief content reviews. The description may also consist of outlines, lists, bullet points, rundowns, segment sequence, edit decision lists, indexes, or tables of content. The descriptor descriptionType is a companion metadata field to the element description. The purpose of descriptionType is to identify the nature of the actual description and flag the form of presentation for the information.

label.name: Temporal Coverage
label.description: Coverage in intellectual content may also be expressed temporally by a date, period, era, or time-based event. Enter a date/time or range of date/times. You can be a specific (eg. 07/14/2001 @ 10:54:01am) or as general (circa 2001) as required.

label.name: Rights
label.description: Use the descriptor rightsSummary as an all-purpose container field to identify information about copyrights and property rights held in and over a media item, whether they are open access or restricted in some way. If dates, times and availability periods are associated with a right, include them. End user permissions, constraints and obligations may also be identified, as needed.

label.name: Rights Summary
label.description: Use the descriptor rightsSummary as an all-purpose container field to identify information about copyrights and property rights held in and over a media item, whether they are open access or restricted in some way. If dates, times and availability periods are associated with a right, include them. End user permissions, constraints and obligations may also be identified, as needed.

settings.setting: To publish images of material from this collection, permission must be obtained in writing from the New School Archives and Special Collections. Please contact: archivist@newschool.edu.

label.name: Time Start
label.description: The descriptor formatTimeStart provides a time stamp for the beginning point of playback for a time-based media item, such as digital video or audio. Use in combination with formatDuration to identify a sequence or segment of a media item that has a fixed start time and end time.

label.name: Duration
label.description: The descriptor formatDuration provides a timestamp for the overall length or duration of a time-based media item. It represents the playback time.

label.name: Data Rate
label.description: The amount of data in a digital media file that is encoded, delivered or distributed, for every second of time. Although optimal data rates are often dependent on the codec used to compress and encode a digital file, a larger data rate translates into a better quality playback experience. Different components of an asset may have their own data rates and when combined report a total data rate. This metadata element can accommodate any of these specifications.

label.name: Colors
label.description: The descriptor formatColors indicates the overall color, grayscale, or black and white nature of a media item, as a single occurrence or combination of occurrences in or throughout the media item.

label.name: Tracks
label.description: The descriptor formatTracks is simply intended to indicate the number and type of tracks that are found in a media item, whether it is analog or digital. Other configuration information specific to these identified tracks should be described using formatChannelConfiguration.

label.name: Channel Configuration
label.description: The descriptor formatChannelConfiguration is designed to indicate the arrangement or configuration of specific channels or layers of information within a media item's tracks. Examples are 2-track mono, 8 track stereo, or video track with alpha channel.

label.name: Language
label.description: The descriptor language identifies the primary language of a media item's audio or text. Alternative audio or text tracks and their associated languages should be identified using the descriptor alternativeModes.

label.name: Essence Track
label.description: pbcoreEssenceTrack is a sub-container of pbcoreInstatiation that enables description of technical details specific to each track in a digital media object.

label.name: Essence Track (Line 1)
label.description: (audio, video, text, etc.)

label.name: Track Type
label.description: (audio, video, text, etc.)

label.name: Essence Track (Line 2)
label.description: the alphanumeric identifier of the track defined by a technical metadata extraction tool or other track metadata reader

label.name: Track Identifier
label.description: the alphanumeric identifier of the track defined by a technical metadata extraction tool or other track metadata reader

label.name: Essence Track (Line 3)
label.description: the name of the software or tool that provided the Track Identifier

label.name: Track Identifier Source
label.description: the name of the software or tool that provided the Track Identifier

label.name: Essence Track (Line 4)
label.description: (NTSC, PAL, ATSC, etc.)

label.name: Track Standard
label.description: (NTSC, PAL, ATSC, etc.)

label.name: Essence Track (Line 5)
label.description: The descriptor trackEncoding identifies how the actual information in a media item is compressed, interpreted, or formulated using a particular scheme.

label.name: Track Encoding
label.description: The descriptor trackEncoding identifies how the actual information in a media item is compressed, interpreted, or formulated using a particular scheme.

label.name: Essence Track (Line 6)
label.description: the amount of data encoded or delivered in this track for for every second of time (8 mb/s, 1930 kb/s, etc)

label.name: Track Data Rate
label.description: the amount of data encoded or delivered in this track for for every second of time (8 mb/s, 1930 kb/s, etc)

label.name: Essence Track (Line 7)
label.description: time stamp for the beginning point of playback

label.name: Track Time Start
label.description: time stamp for the beginning point of playback

label.name: Essence Track (Line 8)
label.description: time stamp for the overall duration of the track

label.name: Track Duration
label.description: time stamp for the overall duration of the track

label.name: Essence Track (Line 9)
label.description: measurement of 'how much' data is sampled during digitization or encoding (10 bit, 16 bit, 24 bit, etc.)

label.name: Track Bit Depth
label.description: measurement of 'how much' data is sampled during digitization or encoding (10 bit, 16 bit, 24 bit, etc.)

label.name: Essence Track (Line 10)
label.description: for audio tracks: measurement of 'how often' data is sampled during digitization or encoding (48 kHz, 96 kHz, etc.)

label.name: Track Sampling Rate
label.description: for audio tracks: measurement of 'how often' data is sampled during digitization or encoding (48 kHz, 96 kHz, etc.)

label.name: Essence Track (Line 11)
label.description: for still and moving image tracks: dimensions of the video image, expressed as horizontal by vertical pixels (640x480, 1920x1080, etc.)

label.name: Track Frame Size
label.description: for still and moving image tracks: dimensions of the video image, expressed as horizontal by vertical pixels (640x480, 1920x1080, etc.)

label.name: Essence Track (Line 12)
label.description: for still or moving image tracks: the ratio of horizontal to vertical proportions in the display of a static or moving image (4:3, 16:9, etc.)

label.name: Track Aspect Ratio
label.description: for still or moving image tracks: the ratio of horizontal to vertical proportions in the display of a static or moving image (4:3, 16:9, etc.)

label.name: Essence Track (Line 13)
label.description: for moving image tracks: frames per second of moving image display (24 fps, 29.97 fps, etc.)

label.name: Track Frame Rate
label.description: for moving image tracks: frames per second of moving image display (24 fps, 29.97 fps, etc.)

label.name: Essence Track (Line 14)
label.description: for audio or text tracks: the primary language of the track

label.name: Track Language
label.description: for audio or text tracks: the primary language of the track

label.name: Essence Track (Line 15)
label.description: any supplementary information about a track.

label.name: Track Annotation
label.description: any supplementary information about a track.

label.name: Annotation
label.description: The descriptor annotation is a stand-alone PBCore element where you can catalog any supplementary information about a media item or the metadata used to describe it. Annotation clarifies element values, terms or descriptors; and vocabularies that may not be otherwise sufficiently understood.
